src.fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.paajarvilauri.util

Class Console

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.paajarvilauri.util.Console

  • public class Console
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains methods where user is prompted to give certain value in console. Uses Scanner-class to do so. Methods often contain either preset or custom error messages given as String parameters, if the user typed something else than what was asked.
    Since:
    1.8
    Version:
    2019-1210
    Author:
    Lauri Paajarvi -lauri.paajarvi@tuni.fi-

    • Method Detail

      • readIntPrintErrorIfNot

        public static int readIntPrintErrorIfNot(java.lang.String errorMessage)
        Reads integer from the user and tries it again with text if error occure

        readIntPrintErrorIfNot int(string) will read an integer from the end-user using java.util.Scanner, and print out an error message (given as parameter) if the user tries to insert a non-integer value.

        Parameters:
        errorMessage - What user sees in case of error
        Returns:
        integer that the user typed in console

      • readInt

        public static int readInt(int min,
                          int max,
                          java.lang.String errorMessageNonNumeric,
                          java.lang.String errorMessageNonMinAndMax)
        Reads Integer from the user with allowed min and max. Errors printed.

        Will use the readIntPrintErrorIfNot -method, but in addition gives out an error message and excepts another answer, if the number is not between min and max, given as parameters. In that case will except another answer from user before continuing.

        Parameters:
        min - Minimum number allowed from the user
        max - Maximum number allowed from the user
        errorMessageNonNumeric - Prints this error if user didnt enter int.
        errorMessageNonMinAndMax - Prints if int was not between min and max.
        Returns:
        The user given integer that is between min and max.

      • readBooleanYorN

        public static boolean readBooleanYorN(java.lang.String question)
        Reads (y/n)-(true/false) boolean value from the user.

        will print out the String given as parameter, while adding " (y/n)" at the end of it, and will continue to do so until the end user manages to provide either y, Y, n or N as first letter in their answer. a boolean value of False. Excepetion will be printed out and the question will be prompted again, in case something unexpected happens. If user hits just enter without providing any information, or tries to write something other than a String containing Y, y, N or n as the first letter, there will be error message shown "Please type Y, y, N or n and press enter to continue."

        Parameters:
        question - Question that is promtpted to the user
        Returns:
        True or false (y or n), based on users answer
